newsitem.title: UK: U.K. Intervention Board details EU sugar sales.
newsitem.headline: U.K. Intervention Board details EU sugar sales.

text.p: A total 18,000 tonnes of current series white sugar received export rebates of a maximum 43.032 European Currency Units (Ecus) per 100 kilos at Wednesday's European Union (EU) tender, the U.K. Intervention Board said.
Traders in France received the entire 18,000 tonnes, it added.
Earlier on Wednesday, London traders had expected the subsidy for the current season whites campaign for licences to to be 43.032 Ecus per 100 kilos, the exact amount awarded.
Traders had also forecast the total authorised sugar tonnage to be between 30,000 and 50,000 tonnes versus 33,000 last week when the restitution was 43.484 Ecus.
